intro: Genipa infundibuliformis, commonly known as the yellow genipapo, is a small evergreen tree native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, grayish bark and simple, opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are followed by yellow or orange berries, which are edible and have a sweet, acidic flavor. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in understory layers of tropical forests. The fruit is also used in traditional medicine and as a source of natural dye.
